Enum.Name: ColorInterpolationMode
Enum.Comment: This determines how the colors in a gradient are interpolated.

Field.Name: ScRgbLinearInterpolation
Field.Comment: Colors are interpolated in the scRGB color space

Field.Name: SRgbLinearInterpolation
Field.Comment: Colors are interpolated in the sRGB color space

Enum.Name: BrushMappingMode
Enum.Comment: Enum which describes whether certain values should be considered as absolute local coordinates or whether they should be considered multiples of a bounding box's size.

Field.Name: Absolute
Field.Comment: Absolute means that the values in question will be interpreted directly in local space.

Field.Name: RelativeToBoundingBox
Field.Comment: RelativeToBoundingBox means that the values will be interpreted as a multiples of a bounding box, where 1.0 is considered 100% of the bounding box measure.

Enum.Name: GradientSpreadMethod
Enum.Comment: This determines how a gradient fills the space outside its primary area.

Field.Name: Pad
Field.Comment: Pad - The final color in the gradient is used to fill the remaining area.

Field.Name: Reflect
Field.Comment: Reflect - The gradient is mirrored and repeated, then mirrored again, etc.

Field.Name: Repeat
Field.Comment: Repeat - The gradient is drawn again and again.

Enum.Name: Stretch
Enum.Comment: Enum which descibes how a source rect should be stretched to fit a destination rect.

Field.Name: None
Field.Comment: Preserve original size

Field.Name: Fill
Field.Comment: Aspect ratio is not preserved, source rect fills destination rect.

Field.Name: Uniform
Field.Comment: Aspect ratio is preserved, Source rect is uniformly scaled as large as possible such that both width and height fit within destination rect. This will not cause source clipping, but it may result in unfilled areas of the destination rect, if the aspect ratio of source and destination are different.

Field.Name: UniformToFill
Field.Comment: Aspect ratio is preserved, Source rect is uniformly scaled as small as possible such that the entire destination rect is filled. This can cause source clipping, if the aspect ratio of source and destination are different.

Enum.Name: MILTransparencyFlags
Enum.Comment: Flags determining the transparency of a render target.

Field.Name: Opaque
Field.Comment: Default is opaque.

Field.Name: ConstantAlpha
Field.Comment: Constant alpha.

Field.Name: PerPixelAlpha
Field.Comment: Per pixel alpha.

Field.Name: ColorKey
Field.Comment: Color key.

Enum.Name: MILWindowLayerType
Enum.Comment: Enum determining the window layer type.

Field.Name: NotLayered
Field.Comment: Not layered.

Field.Name: SystemManagedLayer
Field.Comment: System managed layer.

Field.Name: ApplicationManagedLayer
Field.Comment: Application managed layer

Enum.Name: MilWindowTargetCachingMode
Enum.Comment: Enum determining the caching mode for the hosted window target.

Field.Name: NotCached
Field.Comment: Not cached, visuals are directly connected.

Field.Name: Cached
Field.Comment: Cached, single buffered.

Enum.Name: TileMode
Enum.Comment: Enum which descibes the drawing of the ends of a line.

Field.Name: None
Field.Comment: Do not tile only the base tile is drawn, the remaining area is left as transparent

Field.Name: Tile
Field.Comment: The basic tile mode the base tile is drawn and the remaining area is filled by repeating the base tile such that the right edge of one tile butts the left edge of the next, and similarly for bottom and top

Field.Name: FlipX
Field.Comment: The same as tile, but alternate columns of tiles are flipped horizontally. The base tile is drawn untransformed.

Field.Name: FlipY
Field.Comment: The same as tile, but alternate rows of tiles are flipped vertically. The base tile is drawn untransformed.

Field.Name: FlipXY
Field.Comment: The combination of FlipX and FlipY. The base tile is drawn untransformed.

Field.Name: Extend
Field.Comment: Extend the edges of the tile out indefinitely

Enum.Name: AlignmentX
Enum.Comment: The AlignmentX enum is used to describe how content is positioned horizontally within a container.

Field.Name: Left
Field.Comment: Align contents towards the left of a space.

Field.Name: Center
Field.Comment: Center contents horizontally.

Field.Name: Right
Field.Comment: Align contents towards the right of a space.

Enum.Name: AlignmentY
Enum.Comment: The AlignmentY enum is used to describe how content is positioned vertically within a container.

Field.Name: Top
Field.Comment: Align contents towards the top of a space.

Field.Name: Center
Field.Comment: Center contents vertically.

Field.Name: Bottom
Field.Comment: Align contents towards the bottom of a space.

Enum.Name: PenLineCap
Enum.Comment: Enum which descibes the drawing of the ends of a line.

Field.Name: Flat
Field.Comment: Flat line cap.

Field.Name: Square
Field.Comment: Square line cap.

Field.Name: Round
Field.Comment: Round line cap.

Field.Name: Triangle
Field.Comment: Triangle line cap.

Enum.Name: PenLineJoin
Enum.Comment: Enum which descibes the drawing of the corners on the line.

Field.Name: Miter
Field.Comment: Miter join.

Field.Name: Bevel
Field.Comment: Bevel join.

Field.Name: Round
Field.Comment: Round join.

Enum.Name: ToleranceType
Enum.Comment: Determines how an error tolerance number will be interpreted.

Enum.Name: GeometryCombineMode
Enum.Comment: This enumeration describes the type of combine operation to be performed.

Field.Name: Union
Field.Comment: Produce a geometry representing the set of points contained in either the first or the second geometry.

Field.Name: Intersect
Field.Comment: Produce a geometry representing the set of points common to the first and the second geometries.

Field.Name: Xor
Field.Comment: Produce a geometry representing the set of points contained in the first geometry or the second geometry, but not both.

Field.Name: Exclude
Field.Comment: Produce a geometry representing the set of points contained in the first geometry but not the second geometry.

Enum.Name: EdgeMode
Enum.Comment: Enum which descibes the manner in which we render edges of non-text primitives.

Field.Name: Unspecified
Field.Comment: No edge mode specfied - do not alter the current edge mode applied to this content.

Field.Name: Aliased
Field.Comment: Render edges of non-text primitives as aliased edges.

Enum.Name: BitmapScalingMode
Enum.Comment: Enum which describes the manner in which we scale the images.

Field.Name: Unspecified
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will chose the optimal algorithm

Field.Name: LowQuality
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will use the fastest mode to scale the images. This may mean a low quality image

Field.Name: HighQuality
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will use the mode which produces a most quality image

Field.Name: Linear
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will use linear interpolation.

Field.Name: Fant
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will use fant interpolation.

Field.Name: NearestNeighbor
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will use nearest-neighbor interpolation.

Enum.Name: ClearTypeHint
Enum.Comment: Enum used for hinting the rendering engine that text can be rendered with ClearType.

Field.Name: Auto
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will use ClearType when it is determined possible. If an intermediate render target has been introduced in the ancestor tree, ClearType will be disabled.

Field.Name: Enabled
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will enable ClearType for this element subtree. Where an intermediate render target is introduced in this subtree, ClearType will once again be disabled.

Enum.Name: CachingHint
Enum.Comment: Enum used for hinting the rendering engine that rendered content can be cached

Field.Name: Unspecified
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will choose algorithm.

Field.Name: Cache
Field.Comment: Cache rendered content when possible.

Enum.Name: TextRenderingMode
Enum.Comment: Enum used for specifying what filter mode text should be rendered with (ClearType, grayscale, aliased).

Field.Name: Auto
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will use a rendering mode compatible with the TextFormattingMode specified for the control

Field.Name: Aliased
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will render text with aliased filtering when possible

Field.Name: Grayscale
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will render text with grayscale filtering when possible

Field.Name: ClearType
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will render text with ClearType filtering when possible

Enum.Name: TextHintingMode
Enum.Comment: Enum used for specifying how text should be rendered with respect to animated or static text

Field.Name: Auto
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will automatically determine whether to draw text with quality settings appropriate to animated or static text

Field.Name: Fixed
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will render text for highest static quality

Field.Name: Animated
Field.Comment: Rendering engine will render text for highest animated quality

Enum.Name: Rotation
Enum.Comment: The rotation to be applied; only multiples of 90 degrees is supported.

Field.Name: Rotate0
Field.Comment: Do not rotate

Field.Name: Rotate90
Field.Comment: Rotate 90 degress

Field.Name: Rotate180
Field.Comment: Rotate 180 degrees

Field.Name: Rotate270
Field.Comment: Rotate 270 degrees

Enum.Name: KernelType
Enum.Comment: Type of blur kernel to use.

Field.Name: Gaussian
Field.Comment: Use a Guassian filter

Field.Name: Box
Field.Comment: Use a Box filter

Enum.Name: EdgeProfile
Enum.Comment: Type of edge profile to use.

Field.Name: Linear
Field.Comment: Use a Linear edge profile

Field.Name: CurvedIn
Field.Comment: Use a curved in edge profile

Field.Name: CurvedOut
Field.Comment: Use a curved out edge profile

Field.Name: BulgedUp
Field.Comment: Use a bulged up edge profile

Enum.Name: ShaderRenderMode
Enum.Comment: Policy for rendering the shader in software.

Field.Name: Auto
Field.Comment: Allow hardware and software

Field.Name: SoftwareOnly
Field.Comment: Force software rendering

Field.Name: HardwareOnly
Field.Comment: Require hardware rendering, ignore otherwise

Enum.Name: RenderingBias
Enum.Comment: Type of bias to give rendering of the effect

Field.Name: Performance
Field.Comment: Bias towards performance

Field.Name: Quality
Field.Comment: Bias towards quality

Enum.Name: TextDecorationLocation
Enum.Comment: Referenced localization of the text decoration

Field.Name: Underline
Field.Comment: Underline position

Field.Name: OverLine
Field.Comment: OverLine position

Field.Name: Strikethrough
Field.Comment: Strikethrough position

Field.Name: Baseline
Field.Comment: Baseline position

Enum.Name: TextDecorationUnit
Enum.Comment: The unit type of text decoration value

Field.Name: FontRecommended
Field.Comment: The unit is the calculated value by layout system

Field.Name: FontRenderingEmSize
Field.Comment: The unit is the rendering Em size

Field.Name: Pixel
Field.Comment: The unit is one pixel

BlockCommentedFields.Comment: Exposed flags: these values are used in third party rasterizers.

Field.Name: Invalid
Field.Comment: invalid message

Field.Name: Last
Field.Comment: Not a real message. This value is one more than message with the greatest numerical value.

Enum.Name: MilSegmentType
Enum.Comment: This enumeration determines the type of the segment.

Field.Name: None
Field.Comment: The segment is invalid. This enumeration value SHOULD never be used.

Field.Name: Line
Field.Comment: The segment is a line segment.

Field.Name: Bezier
Field.Comment: The segment is a cubic Bezier segment.

Field.Name: QuadraticBezier
Field.Comment: The segment is a quadratic Bezier segment.

Field.Name: Arc
Field.Comment: The segment is an elliptical arc segment.

Field.Name: PolyLine
Field.Comment: This segment is a series of line segments.

Field.Name: PolyBezier
Field.Comment: This segment is a series of cubic Bezier segments.

Field.Name: PolyQuadraticBezier
Field.Comment: This segment is a series of quadratic Bezier segments.

Enum.Name: MilCoreSeg
Enum.Comment: This enumeration defines flags of the segment.

Field.Name: IsAGap
Field.Comment: When this bit is set then this segment is not to be stroked

Field.Name: SmoothJoin
Field.Comment: When this bit is set then the join between this segment and the PREVIOUS segment will be rounded upon widening, regardless of the pen line join property.

Field.Name: Closed
Field.Comment: When this bit is set on the first type then the figure should be closed.

Field.Name: IsCurved
Field.Comment: This bit indicates whether the segment is curved.

Enum.Name: MilRTInitialization
Enum.Comment: This enumeration specifies the render target initialization flags. These flags can be combined using the bit-wise alternative operation to describe more complex properties.

Field.Name: Default
Field.Comment: Default initialization flags (0) imply hardware with software fallback, synchronized to reduce tearing for hw RTs, and no retention of contents between scenes.

Field.Name: SoftwareOnly
Field.Comment: This flag disables the hardware accelerated RT. Use only software.

Field.Name: HardwareOnly
Field.Comment: This flag disables the software RT. Use only hardware.

Field.Name: Null
Field.Comment: Creates a dummy render target that consumes all calls

Field.Name: TypeMask
Field.Comment: Mask for choice of render target

Field.Name: PresentImmediately
Field.Comment: This flag indicates that presentation should not wait for any specific time to promote the results to the display. This may result in display tearing.

Field.Name: PresentRetainContents
Field.Comment: This flag makes the RT reatin the contents from one frame to the next. Retaining the contents has performance implications. For scene changes with little to update retaining contents may help, but if most of the scene will be repainted anyway, retention may hurt some hw scenarios.

Field.Name: NeedDestinationAlpha
Field.Comment: This flag indicates that the render target backbuffer will have an alpha channel that is at least 8 bits wide.

Field.Name: SingleThreadedUsage
Field.Comment: This flag assumes that all resources (such as bitmaps and render targets) are released on the same thread as the rendering device. This flag enables us to use a single threaded dx device instead of a multi-threaded one.

Field.Name: RenderNonClient
Field.Comment: This flag directs the render target to extend its presentation area to include the non-client area. The origin of the render target space will be equal to the origin of the window.

Field.Name: DisableDisplayClipping
Field.Comment:
This flag directed the render target not to restrict its rendering and presentation to the visible portion of window on the desktop. This is useful for when the window position may be faked or the system may try to make use of window contents that are not recognized as visible. For example DWM thumbnails expect a fully rendered and presented window.
Note: This does not guarantee that some clipping will not be used.

Field.Name: ForceCompatible
Field.Comment: This flag forces the creation of a render target bitmap to match its parent's type, so a software surface only creates software RTs and a hardware surface only creates hardware RTs. This is necessary for the hardware-accelerated bitmap effects pipeline to guarantee that we do not encounter a situation where we're trying to run shaders sampling from a hardware texture to render into a software intermediate.

Field.Name: DisableMultimonDisplayClipping
Field.Comment: This flag is the same as DisableDisplayClipping except that it disables display clipping on multi-monitor configurations in all OS'. This flag is automatically set on Windows 8 and newer systems. If WPF decides to unset DisableDisplayClipping, then DisableMultimonDisplayClipping flag will not be respected even if set by an applicaiton via its manifest

Field.Name: IsDisableMultimonDisplayClippingValid
Field.Comment: This flag is passed down by PresentationCore to tell wpfgfx that the DisableMultimonDisplayClipping compatibity flag is set by the user. This allows us to distinguish between when DisableMultimonDisplayClipping == 0 means that the user set it to false explicitly, versus when the user didn't set it and the DisableMultimonDisplayClipping bit happens to be implicitly set to 0

Field.Name: UseRefRast
Field.Comment: This flag forces the render target to use the d3d9 reference raster when using d3d. (Should be combined with Default or HardwareOnly) This is designed for test apps only

Field.Name: UseRgbRast
Field.Comment: This flag forces the render target to use the rgb reference raster when using d3d.( Should be combined with Default or HardwareOnly ) This is designed for test apps only

BlockCommentedFields.Comment: We support 4 primary present modes: 1) Present using D3D 2) Present using BitBlt to a DC 3) Present using AlphaBlend to a DC 4) Present using UpdateLayeredWindow

Field.Name: PresentUsingGdi
Field.Comment: Present this window using GDI

Enum.Name: MilStretchMode
Enum.Comment: This enumeration describes how a source rectangle should be stretched to fit a destination rectangle.

Field.Name: SourceOverNonPremultiplied
Field.Comment: Do not use the non-premultiplied blend with premultiplied sources. Use non-premultiplied sources carefully.

Enum.Name: MilMarshalType
Enum.Comment: MIL marshal type (related to the transport type)

Field.Name: Pixel
Field.Comment: Each unit is one device pixel.

Field.Name: Point
Field.Comment: Each unit is a printer's point, or 1/72 inch.

Field.Name: Inch
Field.Comment: Each unit is 1 inch.

Field.Name: Document
Field.Comment: Each unit is 1/300 inch.

Field.Name: Millimeter
Field.Comment: Each unit is 1 millimeter.

Field.Name: Metafile
Field.Comment: Each unit is 1/100 millimeter.

Field.Name: WVG
Field.Comment: Each unit is 1/96 inch.

Enum.Name: MilClipCombineMode
Enum.Comment: We may want to add an exclude combine mode later

Field.Name: NearestNeighbor
Field.Comment: Nearest Neighbor filtering. Also known as nearest pixel or nearest point sampling.

Field.Name: Linear
Field.Comment: Linear filtering.

Field.Name: Cubic
Field.Comment: Cubic filtering. May include linear pre-filtering or decimation.

Field.Name: TriLinear
Field.Comment: Trilinear filtering. Not available in WICBitmapInterpolation modes.

Field.Name: Anisotropic
Field.Comment:
Anisotropic filtering. Not available in WICBitmapInterpolation modes.
Anisotropic Filtering implies trilinear filtering with higher quality sampling.

Field.Name: Solid
Field.Comment: Solid color - picks the nearest matching color with no attempt to halftone or dither. May be used on an arbitrary palette.

BlockCommentedFields.Comment:
Ordered dithers and spiral dithers must be used with a fixed palette or a fixed palette translation.
NOTE: DitherOrdered4x4 is unique in that it may apply to 16bpp conversions also.

Field.Name: ErrorDiffusion
Field.Comment: Error diffusion. May be used with any palette.

Field.Name: Custom
Field.Comment: Arbitrary custom palette provided by caller.

Field.Name: MedianCut
Field.Comment: Optimal palette generated using a median-cut algorithm.

Field.Name: FixedBW
Field.Comment: Black and white palette.

BlockCommentedFields.Comment: Symmetric halftone palettes. Each of these halftone palettes will be a superset of the system palette. E.g. Halftone8 will have it's 8-color on-off primaries and the 16 system colors added. With duplicates removed, that leaves 16 colors.

Field.Name: FixedHalftone8
Field.Comment: 8-color, on-off primaries

Field.Name: FixedHalftone27
Field.Comment: 3 intensity levels of each color

Field.Name: FixedHalftone64
Field.Comment: 4 intensity levels of each color

Field.Name: FixedHalftone125
Field.Comment: 5 intensity levels of each color

Field.Name: FixedHalftone216
Field.Comment: 6 intensity levels of each color

Field.Name: FixedWebPalette
Field.Comment: convenient web palette, same as FixedHalftone216

BlockCommentedFields.Comment: Assymetric halftone palettes. These are somewhat less useful than the symmetric ones, but are included for completeness. These do not include all of the system colors.

Field.Name: FixedHalftone252
Field.Comment: 6-red, 7-green, 6-blue intensities

Field.Name: FixedHalftone256
Field.Comment: 8-red, 8-green, 4-blue intensities

Field.Name: FixedGray4
Field.Comment: 4 shades of gray

Field.Name: FixedGray16
Field.Comment: 16 shades of gray

Field.Name: FixedGray256
Field.Comment: 256 shades of gray

BlockCommentedFields.Comment: sRGB formats (gamma is approx. 2.2) For a full definition, see the sRGB spec

Field.Name: BGR16bpp555
Field.Comment: 16bpp format

Field.Name: BGR16bpp565
Field.Comment: 16bpp format

Field.Name: Gray16bpp
Field.Comment: 16bpp format

Field.Name: BGR24bpp
Field.Comment: 24bpp format

Field.Name: RGB24bpp
Field.Comment: 24bpp format

Field.Name: BGR32bpp
Field.Comment: 32bpp format

Field.Name: BGRA32bpp
Field.Comment: 32bpp format

Field.Name: PBGRA32bpp
Field.Comment: 32bpp format

Field.Name: Gray32bppFloat
Field.Comment: 32bpp format

Field.Name: RGB48bppFixedPoint
Field.Comment: 48bpp format

BlockCommentedFields.Comment: scRGB formats. Gamma is 1.0 For a full definition, see the scRGB spec

Field.Name: Gray16bppFixedPoint
Field.Comment: 16bpp format

Field.Name: BGR32bpp101010
Field.Comment: 32bpp format

Field.Name: RGB48bpp
Field.Comment: 48bpp format

Field.Name: RGBA64bpp
Field.Comment: 64bpp format

Field.Name: PRGBA64bpp
Field.Comment: 64bpp format

Field.Name: BGR96bppFixedPoint
Field.Comment: 96bpp format

Field.Name: RGBA128bppFloat
Field.Comment: Floating point scRGB format

Field.Name: PRGBA128bppFloat
Field.Comment: Floating point scRGB format

Field.Name: RGB128bppFloat
Field.Comment: Floating point scRGB format

Command.Name: SetVBlankSyncMode
Command.SecurityComment: 2007/02/25-polszta: this command is meant for WPF's local compositor only, code that sends this command might have non-security related issues if responding to this command.

Command.Name: NotifyPresent
Command.SecurityComment: 2007/02/25-polszta: this command is meant for DWM's local compositor only, code that sends this command might have non-security related issues if responding to this command.

Command.Name: Update
Command.SecurityComment: 2007/02/25-polszta: the pointer field needs to be deprecated in favor of pointer escrow mechanism. If the command transport is denied, we will fail to preserve compatibility with WPF V1, hence appropriate care not to use the pointer needs to be taken in the command handler.

Command.Name: Create
Command.SecurityComment: 2005/09/12-polszta: this should be local machine only.

Command.Name: SuppressLayered
Command.SecurityComment: 2007/02/25-polszta: this is only relevant to local transport, if sent over the wire could break multi-hop remoting.

Command.Name: Create
Command.SecurityComment: 2007/02/25-polszta: this command contains a pointer field that is not properly validated. Replace with pointer escrow. Limiting to local transport only.

Resource.Name: MilGraphicsAccelerationCaps
Resource.Comment: Description of a display or display set's graphics capabilities.

Field.Name: TierValue
Field.Comment: Tier value

Field.Name: HasWDDMSupport
Field.Comment: True if WDDM driver is supporting display

Field.Name: PixelShaderVersion
Field.Comment: pixel shader version

Field.Name: VertexShaderVersion
Field.Comment: vertex shader version

Field.Name: MaxTextureWidth
Field.Comment: max texture width

Field.Name: MaxTextureHeight
Field.Comment: max texture height

Field.Name: WindowCompatibleMode
Field.Comment: The accelerated rendering is supported for a windowed application

Field.Name: BitsPerPixel
Field.Comment: Per pixel bit depth of display

Field.Name: HasSSE2Support
Field.Comment: Processor support for SSE2 instruction set.

Field.Name: MaxPixelShader30InstructionSlots
Field.Comment: Maximum number of instruction slots, if pixel shader 3.0 is supported

Resource.Name: MilGraphicsAccelerationAssessment
Resource.Comment: Assessment of the video memory bandwidth and total video memory as set by WinSAT. Used by the DWM to determine glass and opaque glass capability of the display machine.

Field.Name: ForcePacking
Field.Comment: See ForcePacking comment at beginning of this file.

Field.Name: ForcePacking
Field.Comment: See ForcePacking comment at beginning of this file.

Field.Name: ForcePacking
Field.Comment: See ForcePacking comment at beginning of this file.

Field.Name: ForcePacking
Field.Comment: See ForcePacking comment at beginning of this file.

Field.Name: ForcePacking
Field.Comment: See ForcePacking comment at beginning of this file.

Field.Name: CommonMinimumCaps
Field.Comment: Is this caps description specific to the primary display or is it the minimum common value across all the displays?

Field.Name: DisplayUniqueness
Field.Comment: Display uniqueness signature. These caps are only valid for given signature.

Field.Name: dwType
Field.Comment: profile type

Field.Name: pProfileData
Field.Comment: filename or buffer containing profile

Field.Name: cbDataSize
Field.Comment: size of profile data

Field.Name: phSize
Field.Comment: profile size in bytes

Field.Name: phCMMType
Field.Comment: CMM for this profile

Field.Name: phVersion
Field.Comment: profile format version number

Field.Name: phClass
Field.Comment: type of profile

Field.Name: phDataColorSpace
Field.Comment: color space of data

Field.Name: phDateTime
Field.Comment: date profile was created

Field.Name: phSignature
Field.Comment: magic number

Field.Name: phPlatform
Field.Comment: primary platform

Field.Name: phProfileFlags
Field.Comment: various bit settings

Field.Name: phManufacturer
Field.Comment: device manufacturer

Field.Name: phModel
Field.Comment: device model number

Field.Name: phAttributes
Field.Comment: device manufacturer

Field.Name: phRenderingIntent
Field.Comment: rendering intent

Field.Name: phIlluminant
Field.Comment: profile illuminant

Field.Name: phCreator
Field.Comment: profile creator

Field.Name: phReserved
Field.Comment: reserved for future use

Field.Name: AutoLayoutContent
Field.Comment: If this property is true, this Brush will run layout on the contents of this Brush if the Visual is a non-parented UIElement.

Field.Name: AutoLayoutContent
Field.Comment: If this property is true, this Brush will run layout on the contents of this Brush if the Visual is a non-parented UIElement.

Field.Name: AutoWrapTarget
Field.Comment: If true, this Brush wrap its Target visual in a ContainerVisual, which will allow the brush to support rendering all properties on the visual above the cache to match VisualBrush's behavior.

Field.Name: Transform
Field.Comment: Transform on the text with this effect

Field.Name: Clip
Field.Comment: Clip on the text with this effect

Field.Name: Foreground
Field.Comment: Foreground for the text with this effect

Field.Name: PositionStart
Field.Comment: The codepoint index of the start of the text effect

Field.Name: PositionCount
Field.Comment: The glyph or codepoint count, based on the graunularity

Field.Name: Pen
Field.Comment: The pen used to draw the text decoration

Field.Name: PenOffset
Field.Comment: The offset of the text decoration to the location specified.

Field.Name: PenOffsetUnit
Field.Comment: The unit type we use to interpret the offset value.

Field.Name: PenThicknessUnit
Field.Comment: The unit type we use to interpret the thickness value.

Field.Name: Location
Field.Comment: The Location of the text decorations

RenderDataInstruction.Name: DrawLine
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Draws a line with the specified pen. Note that this API does not accept a Brush, as there is no area to fill.

Field.Name: pen
Field.Comment: The Pen with which to stroke the line.

Field.Name: point0
Field.Comment: The start Point for the line.

Field.Name: point1
Field.Comment: The end Point for the line.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: DrawRectangle
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Draw a rectangle with the provided Brush and/or Pen. If both the Brush and Pen are null this call is a no-op.

Field.Name: brush
Field.Comment: The Brush with which to fill the rectangle. This is optional, and can be null, in which case no fill is performed.

Field.Name: pen
Field.Comment: The Pen with which to stroke the rectangle. This is optional, and can be null, in which case no stroke is performed.

Field.Name: rectangle
Field.Comment: The Rect to fill and/or stroke.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: DrawRoundedRectangle
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Draw a rounded rectangle with the provided Brush and/or Pen. If both the Brush and Pen are null this call is a no-op.

Field.Name: brush
Field.Comment: The Brush with which to fill the rectangle. This is optional, and can be null, in which case no fill is performed.

Field.Name: pen
Field.Comment: The Pen with which to stroke the rectangle. This is optional, and can be null, in which case no stroke is performed.

Field.Name: rectangle
Field.Comment: The Rect to fill and/or stroke.

Field.Name: radiusX
Field.Comment: The radius in the X dimension of the rounded corners of this rounded Rect. This value will be clamped to the range [0..rectangle.Width/2]

Field.Name: radiusY
Field.Comment: The radius in the Y dimension of the rounded corners of this rounded Rect. This value will be clamped to the range [0..rectangle.Height/2].

RenderDataInstruction.Name: DrawEllipse
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Draw an ellipse with the provided Brush and/or Pen. If both the Brush and Pen are null this call is a no-op.

Field.Name: brush
Field.Comment: The Brush with which to fill the ellipse. This is optional, and can be null, in which case no fill is performed.

Field.Name: pen
Field.Comment: The Pen with which to stroke the ellipse. This is optional, and can be null, in which case no stroke is performed.

Field.Name: center
Field.Comment: The center of the ellipse to fill and/or stroke.

Field.Name: radiusX
Field.Comment: The radius in the X dimension of the ellipse. The absolute value of the radius provided will be used.

Field.Name: radiusY
Field.Comment: The radius in the Y dimension of the ellipse. The absolute value of the radius provided will be used.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: DrawGeometry
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Draw a Geometry with the provided Brush and/or Pen. If both the Brush and Pen are null this call is a no-op.

Field.Name: brush
Field.Comment: The Brush with which to fill the Geometry. This is optional, and can be null, in which case no fill is performed.

Field.Name: pen
Field.Comment: The Pen with which to stroke the Geometry. This is optional, and can be null, in which case no stroke is performed.

Field.Name: geometry
Field.Comment: The Geometry to fill and/or stroke.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: DrawImage
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Draw an Image into the region specified by the Rect. The Image will potentially be stretched and distorted to fit the Rect. For more fine grained control, consider filling a Rect with an ImageBrush via DrawRectangle.

Field.Name: imageSource
Field.Comment: The ImageSource to draw.

Field.Name: rectangle
Field.Comment: The Rect into which the ImageSource will be fit.

Field.Name: foregroundBrush
Field.Comment: Foreground brush to draw the GlyphRun with.

Field.Name: glyphRun
Field.Comment: The GlyphRun to draw.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: DrawDrawing
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Draw a Drawing by appending a sub-Drawing to the current Drawing.

Field.Name: drawing
Field.Comment: The drawing to draw.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: DrawVideo
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Draw a Video into the region specified by the Rect. The Video will potentially be stretched and distorted to fit the Rect. For more fine grained control, consider filling a Rect with an VideoBrush via DrawRectangle.

Field.Name: player
Field.Comment: The MediaPlayer to draw.

Field.Name: rectangle
Field.Comment: The Rect into which the media will be fit.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: PushClip
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Push a clip region, which will apply to all drawing primitives until the corresponding Pop call.

Field.Name: clipGeometry
Field.Comment: The Geometry to which we will clip.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: PushOpacityMask
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Push an opacity mask which will blend the composite of all drawing primitives added until the corresponding Pop call.

Field.Name: opacityMask
Field.Comment: The opacity mask

Field.Name: boundingBoxCacheLocalSpace
Field.Comment: Storage in which to cache bounds

RenderDataInstruction.Name: PushOpacity
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Push an opacity which will blend the composite of all drawing primitives added until the corresponding Pop call.

Field.Name: opacity
Field.Comment: The opacity with which to blend - 0 is transparent, 1 is opaque.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: PushTransform
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Push a Transform which will apply to all drawing operations until the corresponding Pop.

Field.Name: transform
Field.Comment: The Transform to push.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: PushGuidelineSet
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Push a set of guidelines which will apply to all drawing operations until the corresponding Pop.

Field.Name: guidelines
Field.Comment: The GuidelineSet to push.

Field.Name: coordinate
Field.Comment: The coordinate of leading guideline.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: PushGuidelineY2
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Explicitly push a pair of horizontal guidelines.

Field.Name: leadingCoordinate
Field.Comment: The coordinate of leading guideline.

Field.Name: offsetToDrivenCoordinate
Field.Comment: The offset from leading guideline to driven guideline.

RenderDataInstruction.Name: PushEffect
RenderDataInstruction.Comment: Push a BitmapEffect which will apply to all drawing operations until the corresponding Pop.

Field.Name: effect
Field.Comment: The BitmapEffect to push.

Field.Name: effectInput
Field.Comment: The BitmapEffectInput.
